sample_chosen: <observation>Parallel resistance formula: $\tfrac{1}{R_{\text{eq}}} = \tfrac{1}{R_1} + \tfrac{1}{R_2}$.</observation>\\<insight>With $6\,\Omega$ and $12\,\Omega$, the combined parallel result is less ...
sample_rejected: For parallel, just do that $1/(R_{\text{eq}})$ sum. We get $4\,\Omega$. Short and sweet!
Multiplying 0.001 kg by $(3\times10^8\,\mathrm{m/s})^2$ yields $9\times10^{13}\,\mathrm{J}$ of energy.
